xyz.swatt.json

Class JsonWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.swatt.json.JsonWrapper

  • @LogMethods
public class JsonWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
    A Helper Class for working with JSON.
    Author:
    Brandon Dudek (BrandonDudek)

    • Field Detail

      • JSON_DOCUMENT

        public final com.jayway.jsonpath.DocumentContext JSON_DOCUMENT
        The Jaway DocumentContext that his JSON Helper is built around. You can use this directly to perform all Jayway JsonPath operations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JsonWrapper

        public JsonWrapper(com.jayway.jsonpath.DocumentContext _jsonDocument)
        Will instantiate this object, for working with given JSON data.
        Parameters:
        _jsonDocument - The JSON DocumentContext to work with.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given JSON DocumentContext is null.

      • JsonWrapper

        public JsonWrapper(java.io.File _jsonFile)
        Will instantiate this object, for working with given JSON data.
        Parameters:
        _jsonFile - The JSON data to work with.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given JSON File is null or does not exist.
        JsonException - If the given JSON File could not be parsed.

      • JsonWrapper

        public JsonWrapper(com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode _jsonNode)
        Will instantiate this object, for working with given JSON data.

        Note:

        Uses the defined Jackson OBJECT_MAPPER.
        Parameters:
        _jsonNode - The JSON data to work with.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given JsonNode is null.
        JsonException - If the given JSON Node could not be parsed or converted.

      • JsonWrapper

        public JsonWrapper(com.google.gson.JsonObject _jsonObject)
        Will instantiate this object, for working with given JSON data.
        Parameters:
        _jsonObject - The JSON data to work with.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given JsonNode is null.
        JsonException - If the given JSON Object could not be parsed or converted.

      • JsonWrapper

        public JsonWrapper(java.lang.String _jsonString)
        Will instantiate this object, for working with given JSON data.
        Parameters:
        _jsonString - The JSON data to work with.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given JSON String is blank.
        JsonException - If the given JSON String could not be parsed or converted.

        Parameters:
        _jsonPath - The String to convert.
        Returns:

      • addToArray

        public void addToArray(com.jayway.jsonpath.JsonPath _jsonPath,
                       java.lang.Object _value)
        Will add the given object to the array specified by the JSON Path.
        Parameters:
        _jsonPath - The JsonPath query to use. (See: JsonPath's Readme on GitHub for details.)
        _value - The Object to Serialize as the Value for the new Entry in the Array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The Json Path is null.

      • addToArray

        Parameters:
        _jsonPath - The JsonPath query to use. (See: JsonPath's Readme on GitHub for details.)
        _value - The Object to Serialize as the Value for the new Entry in the Array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The Json Path is blank or invalid.

        public void deleteNodes(com.jayway.jsonpath.JsonPath _jsonPath)

        Parameters:
        _jsonPath - The JsonPath query to use. (See: JsonPath's Readme on GitHub for details.)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The Json Path is null.

        Parameters:
        _jsonPath - The JsonPath query to use. (See: JsonPath's Readme on GitHub for details.)
        Throws:

      • getJsonAsDocumentContext

        public com.jayway.jsonpath.DocumentContext getJsonAsDocumentContext()
        Returns:
        The JSON Document that this JsonWrapper is build around, as a Jaway DocumentContext.

      • getJsonAsJsonNode

        public com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode getJsonAsJsonNode()
        Returns:
        The JSON Document that this JsonWrapper is build around, as a Jackson JsonNode.

        Note:

        Uses the defined Jackson OBJECT_MAPPER.

      • getJsonAsJsonObject

        public com.google.gson.JsonObject getJsonAsJsonObject()
        Returns:
        The JSON Document that this JsonWrapper is build around, as a Google, Gson JsonObject.

        Note:

        Used the default Jackson JsonParser.

      • getJsonAsString

        public java.lang.String getJsonAsString()
        Returns:
        The JSON Document that this JsonWrapper is build around, as a String.

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(com.jayway.jsonpath.JsonPath _jsonPath)
        Will query this JSON Document, with the given JSON Path, and return the result.
        Parameters:
        _jsonPath - The JsonPath query to use. (See: JsonPath's Readme on GitHub for details.)
        Returns:
        The result, as Strings; or null, if no result was found.

        Note: If an Object or Array is found, it will be returned as a JSON String.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The Json Path is null.
        TooManyResultsException - If more than 1 result is found.

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String _jsonPath)
        Will query this JSON Document, with the given JSON Path, and return the result.
        Parameters:
        _jsonPath - The JsonPath query to use. (See: JsonPath's Readme on GitHub for details.)
        Returns:
        The result, as Strings; or null, if no result was found.

        Note: If an Object or Array is found, it will be returned as a JSON String.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The Json Path is null.
        TooManyResultsException - If more than 1 result is found.

      • getStrings

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStrings(com.jayway.jsonpath.JsonPath _jsonPath)
        Will query this JSON Document, with the given JSON Path, and return the results.
        Parameters:
        _jsonPath - The JsonPath query to use. (See: JsonPath's Readme on GitHub for details.)
        Returns:
        A List will all of the results, as Strings.

        Note: If an Object is found, it will be returned as a JSON String. If an Array is found, each of it's elements will be parsed and added to the returned List.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The Json Path is null.
        JsonException - If the given Path found an unknown JSON Object.

      • getStrings

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStrings(java.lang.String _jsonPath)
        Will query this JSON Document, with the given JSON Path, and return the results.
        Parameters:
        _jsonPath - The JsonPath query to use. (See: JsonPath's Readme on GitHub for details.)
        Returns:
        A List will all of the results, as Strings.

        Note: If an Object is found, it will be returned as a JSON String. If an Array is found, each of it's elements will be parsed and added to the returned List.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The Json Path is blank or invalid.

      • putInMapOrObject

        public void putInMapOrObject(com.jayway.jsonpath.JsonPath _jsonPath,
                             java.lang.String _key,
                             java.lang.Object _value)
        Will put the given <key, object> pair into the Map/Object specified by the JSON Path.
        Parameters:
        _jsonPath - The JsonPath query to use. (See: JsonPath's Readme on GitHub for details.)
        _key - The Variable Name / Map Key to use for the new Value.
        _value - The Object to Serialize as the Value for the new Entry in the Map.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The Json Path is null.

      • putInMapOrObject

        public void putInMapOrObject(java.lang.String _jsonPath,
                             java.lang.String _key,
                             java.lang.Object _value)
        Will put the given <key, object> pair into the Map/Object specified by the JSON Path.
        Parameters:
        _jsonPath - The JsonPath query to use. (See: JsonPath's Readme on GitHub for details.)
        _key - The Variable Name / Map Key to use for the new Value.
        _value - The Object to Serialize as the Value for the new Entry in the Map.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The Json Path is blank or invalid.

      • setNode

        public void setNode(com.jayway.jsonpath.JsonPath _jsonPath,
                    java.lang.Object _value)
        Will query this JSON Document, with the given JSON Path, and delete all nodes found.
        Parameters:
        _jsonPath - The JsonPath query to use. (See: JsonPath's Readme on GitHub for details.)
        _value - The Object to Serialize as the Value for the new Node.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The Json Path is null.

      • setNode

        public void setNode(java.lang.String _jsonPath,
                    java.lang.Object _value)
        Will query this JSON Document, with the given JSON Path, and delete all nodes found.
        Parameters:
        _jsonPath - The JsonPath query to use. (See: JsonPath's Readme on GitHub for details.)
        _value - The Object to Serialize as the Value for the new Node.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The Json Path is blank or invalid.
